statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Brigham Young 84, Idaho State 78 (OT)
article.story: PROVO, Utah (AP) -- BYU overcame 20 second half points by Idaho State's Abdul-Ahad Akbar and survived overtime to capture an 84-78 win over the Bengals Saturday night. BYU (1-1) led 42-29 at the half after Austin Kilpatrick's 3-pointer at the buzzer. Idaho State (1-2) began the second half with a 29-8 run, which helped the Bengals to a 58-50 lead. During the run, Akbar tied the game at 45 on a 3-pointer with 12:15 remaining. Two minutes later Akbar gave the Bengals their first lead at 48-47 with a 3-point play. The Cougars hit only 1-of-12 shots to begin the second half after shooting 61 percent from the field in the first half. Down 58-50 with 7:11 remaining, BYU responded with an 11-2 run of its own taking the lead at 61-60 with 4:03 remaining on a 3-pointer by Keena Young. BYU maintained a lead down the stretch until Akbar hit a 3-pointer with seconds remaining in regulation to force overtime. Young's shot to begin the overtime period gave the Cougars a lead they wouldn't relinquish. Young also led BYU in rebounding with 10, giving him his first double-double of the season. Idaho State's John Ofoegbu scored 17 while Logan Kinghorn and David Schroeder scored 12 and 11 points respectively. Schroeder also had a game-high five steals.
